register.description: Starts / stops the counters clears the error signal

bitfield.description: The DONEENA bit enables/disables the done signal. 0101 = disabled & 1010 = enabled
Single/Continuous checking mode. 0101 = Continuous & 1010 = Single
The ERRENA bit enables/disables the error signal. 0101 = disabled & 1010 = enabled
The DCCENA bit starts and stops the operation of the dcc 0101 = disabled & 1010 = enabled

register.description: Seed value for the counter attached to clock source 0

bitfield.description: The seed value for Counter 0. The seed value that gets loaded into counter 0 (clock source 0)

register.description: Seed value for the timeout counter attached to clock source 0

bitfield.description: The seed value for Valid Duration Counter 0.The seed value that gets loaded into the valid duration counter for clock source 0

register.description: Seed value for the counter attached to clock source 1

bitfield.description: The seed value for Counter 1. The seed value that gets loaded into counter 1 (clock source 1

register.description: Contains the error & done flag bit

bitfield.description: Indicates whether or not an done has occured. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.
Indicates whether or not an error has occured. Writing a 1 to this bit clears the flag.

register.description: Value of the counter attached to clock source 0

bitfield.description: Reserved
This field contains the current value of counter 0. - (RO )

register.description: Value of the valid counter attached to clock source 0

bitfield.description: This field contains the current value of valid counter 0. - (RO )

register.description: Value of the counter attached to clock source 1

bitfield.description: Reserved
This field contains the current value of counter 1. - (RO )
Reserved
Key Programing (1010 is the KEY Value)

FIFO update on Non-Error Enables/disables FIFO writes without the error event on completion of comparison window. 0101: Counter values are captured to non-full FIFO only upon Error event Others: Write counter values to non-full FIFO upon completion of comparison window regardless of error or not. Note this setting is applicable only in Continuous mode; in single shot mode FIFO captures counts only on Error. Note: The user should write 1010 to these enable fields to enable each feature to avoid single soft errors.

FIFO Read Enable Enables the counter read registers reflect FIFO output instead of live counter value. 0101: Counter value is read directly. Others: FIFO output is read Note: The user should write 1010 to these enable fields to enable each feature to avoid single soft errors.

Continue on Error enable Continues to next window of comparison despite the error condition. 0101: Comparison and counter reload is stopped from advancing if error is detected. Others: Counters get reloaded with seed and continue counting despite the error condition. Note: The user should write 1010 to these enable fields to enable each feature to avoid single soft errors.
Count1 FIFO Full Indicates whether Count1 FIFO is Full. 0: Count1 FIFO is not Full 1: Count1 FIFO is Full.
Valid0 FIFO Full Indicates whether Valid0 FIFO is Full. 0: Valid0 FIFO is not Full 1: Valid0 FIFO is Full.
Count0 FIFO Full Indicates whether Count0 FIFO is Full. 0: Count0 FIFO is not Full 1: Count0 FIFO is Full.
Count1 FIFO Empty Indicates whether Count1 FIFO is Empty. 0: Count1 FIFO is not empty 1: Count1 FIFO is empty.
Valid0 FIFO Empty Indicates whether Valid0 FIFO is Empty. 0: Valid0 FIFO is not empty 1: Valid0 FIFO is empty.
Count0 FIFO Empty Indicates whether Count0 FIFO is Empty. 0: Count0 FIFO is not empty 1: Count0 FIFO is empty.
Counts the number of errors after the last write to this register or reset. If reached terminal count the count freezes. User needs to clear it.
